page.title: 07TOURIST ATTRACTIONS
page.content: The{Wye Valley}area is popular with walkers.You can walk along the valley from{Newland}to{Lower Redbrook,}on the old railway track alongside the river near{Redbrook}and along the{Offa's } {Dyke Path}which runs the length of {Highbury Hill}before dropping down into{Redbrook.}Running by the side of {Newland Post Office}is the{Burial Path which leads to{Coleford}and along which coffins were brought for burial in{Newland. {Redbrook}itself has much{industrial} {history}with a tradition of metal working. By the riverside a small {warehouse}marks the site of a boat {building yard}where, during the 19th. century,the{Wye trows}and{barges}were built.On the{Penallt}side of the river bank are{mill-stones}fashioned on the hill out of local pudding stone and brought down to be loaded on to boats.
